body.p: If you notice that some of the CSS properties were not applied as expected, some of the tips offered in this topic might help you with the debugging process.

section.title: Inspecting the Merged Map File
section.p:
During the transformation stages, two merged map files are created. These files could be used to help debug unexpected results.
The first thing you should try is to check the file structure of the HTML merged map file. This file can be found in the out/pdf-css directory and it has the .merged.html file extension (you will also find a .merged.xml file that aggregates the entire ditamap structure). You can open the HTML files in Oxygen XML Editor/Author to examine the structure. Optionally, you can use the pretty print feature (Format and Indent) to make the structure easier to read.
If the structure is as expected, you can start checking that the CSS selectors are written correctly against the document structure.
If the CSS selectors are correctly written, you can start inspecting how the styles are applied (you can try any of the methods listed below).

section.title: Inspecting the Applied Styles Using a Browser
section.sectiondiv: To inspect the applied CSS styles using your browser (for example using Chrome - but you can use any other browser):

ol.li:
Open the Chrome Developer Tools by using
More Tools Developer Tools (or press CTRL+SHIFT+I).

Activate the Rendering pane by using
More Tools Rendering :

In the Rendering pane, select print from the Emulate CSS media section. This will activate the CSS selectors enclosed in @media print {..}. This allows you to debug the styling of elements, table of contents, and index, but not the styles of the page margin boxes (headers, footers) or page breaks.

Click on the element you want to inspect, then from the contextual menu click the Inspect action, you will see the clicked element (in the Elements pane) and the list of styles that applied on it (in the Styles pane):Clinking any of the stylesheet links from the Styles pane opens the original CSS files in the Sources pane. Editing the rules in that pane results in a live preview of how the change will affect the output ; these modifications will be lost on reload.

section.title: Inspecting the Applied Styles Using Oxygen XML Editor/Author
section.sectiondiv: To inspect the applied CSS styles using Oxygen:

ol.li: In Oxygen XML Editor/Author, open the file ending in .merged.html.

From the Styles toolbar, choose the + Print Ready entry. This will activate certain CSS selectors enclosed in @media print {..}.This allows you to debug the styling of elements, table of contents, and index, but not the styles of the page margin boxes (headers, footers) or page breaks.

Click on the element you want to inspect, then from the contextual menu click the Inspect Styles action. The dedicated CSS Inspector view will open and show the applied CSS rules.With this file open in Author mode, it might be helpful to switch the Tags Display Mode to Full Tags with Attributes. You might be able to identify the selector you need to style without using the CSS Inspector view.

section.title: Debugging techniques
section.p: These are some other techniques you may find useful:

ul.li: Add background and borders properties to the specific CSS rule. If they do not appear in the output then there is a problem with the rule selector.
Add the !important keyword to a property that is not applied, or make the selector more specific (by adding more parent selectors).
